What did you think of the game. I noted two of your notables were out.

 
 
 Our two top players were out - including our star Kevin Garnett. I thought our boys did a good job giving yours a run for the money in the first half, but the second half was like watching a train wreck. You guys' offense is pretty amazing. I am proud of my Randy Foye - I have been cooing over that rookie for some time now and he did really well despite the game being lost. Troy Hudson wasn't bad either.

 How was the tournament or has it happened yet?
 
 Huck

They did really well at the tournament. My son plays on the city of Minneapolis' Park And Recreation Board's league. Practice once a week and one game a week - and they are only a couple of weeks into the season. 
 
 The tournament was in the AAU leagues. 3-4 games a weekend, multiple practices and months of playing. Our guys won their first game and made life hard for the other two teams they played. I am really proud of them. It was a good learning experience and I think they are going to come back into their regular league pretty tough.
 
 They should have won the second game, but my kid and one other kid got mad at each other, lost focus and threw the game off for the whole team. Coach pulled them off the floor and chewed them out - after that they kept up with the other team, but had lost too much ground at the beginning to catch up.
 
 I had a little chat with my kid about how when he is mad, or another player is mad and throwing down a bad attitude - the focus, for himself and his teamates, is on his crud - while the other team is focused on the game. He got it. This other kid does not. He gets mad all the time, insults his team when they make mistakes, gets mad at the refs when they make calls against him and earns us technical fouls. He also won't share the ball, which has lost us the ball more than once. He is turning into a liability - and its a pity because he is a really talented player.
 
 Are there no other basketball fans in this forum????
The Wolves kicked butt last night. Beat the Warriers by 28 points. Why can't they play like that all the time?

so far it looks like it is us. Everone else seems to be hitting the religion, abortion, politics and evolution threads pretty hard. I am mostly bored by such things. I like philosophy though.
 
 I am glad to hear your son understood what it does. To be a leader we must do what is best for others to assist them to become the best they can be. That is what leadership is about. It is less of a "follow me" and more of a "let me serve you" kind of thing.
 
 I see good unselfish play in the suns. It is one of the reasons I enjoy watching the team so much. It is not dependent on one person (although Nash does add a lot) but they all work together to win games. It is very cool.
 
 I am sorry for the other kiddo though. I wonder if he is willing to let someone else lead him at all? I wonder what goes on in his life that makes him so hard?
 
 But that is me.
 
 Have a good one.
 
 Huck

I am sorry for the other kiddo though. I wonder if he is willing to let someone else lead him at all? I wonder what goes on in his life that makes him so hard?
 

 
 We live in an inner-city neighborhood. A rough one. Lots of very cool people - and lots of troubled kids - so who knows?
 
 You gonna watch the All Star game on the 18th? The Suns have three players on the team (Steve Nash, Shawn Marion and Amare Stoudemire). The starters are Kevin Garnett (yeah!), Kobe Byrant, Tracy McGrady Tim Duncan and Yoa Ming. 
 
 Other players for the Wester Conference are: Carlos Boozer, Allen Iverson, Dirk Nowitzki and Tony Parker.
 
 Starters for the East are - Gilbert Arenas, Chris Bosh, LeBron James, Shaq, and Dwayne (wish he were my boyfriend) Wade. Alternates: Chauncey Billups, Caron Butler, Vince Carter, Dwight Howard, Jason Kidd, Jermain O'Neil.
 
 I think we have more shinies than them. Although they do have King James. Should be fun to watch.

 My Wolves win and then lose and then win and then lose. They are hands down the most inconsistent team in the NBA. They kill a team like the Pistons or your Suns and then lose to the Grizzlies....
 
 Anyway - my Smelly (son's nickname) is dang fine at defense. Doesn't get imtimidated by the big guys. They won last night. The team they were playing had one kid who was easily 6ft (these are 12 year olds). Our guys were intimidated at first - until they figured out that all the kid had was tallness- zero skill. They would just perch him under the basket. We were stopping them and taking the ball left and right. We doubled our score in the first minute and half of the second half (10 to 20 points). Its fun to watch these kids. So many of these city kids have been playing at hoops since they could walk! It's also funny because the boys are at a clumsy age - they trip over their own feet as often as they make baskets.

Hope your dad is OK.
